To the chief Musician, <FI>A Psalm<Fi> of David. The fool hath said in his heart, <FI>There is<Fi> no God. They are corrupt, they have done abominable works, <FI>there is<Fi> none that doeth good.
The LORD looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, <FI>and<Fi> seek God.
They are all gone aside, they are <FI>all<Fi> together become filthy: <FI>there is<Fi> none that doeth good, no, not one.<RF>filthy: Heb. stinking<Rf><CM>
Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people <FI>as<Fi> they eat bread, and call not upon the LORD.
There were they in great fear: for God <FI>is<Fi> in the generation of the righteous.<RF>were…: Heb. they feared a fear<Rf>
Ye have shamed the counsel of the poor, because the LORD <FI>is<Fi> his refuge.

Oh that the salvation of Israel <FI>were come<Fi> out of Zion! when the LORD bringeth back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, <FI>and<Fi> Israel shall be glad.<RF>Oh…: Heb. Who will give<Rf><CM>
